contentrichtext.text: {{Multiple issues| {{unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{notability|date=January 2011}} }} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:LittleMarvelRecord.jpg|right|thumb|200px|Little Marvel label]] --> '''Little Marvel''' was a [[United Kingdom]] [[record label]] which issued small (5Â½ - 6 inch) [[gramophone record]]s during the 1920s. The label was owned by the [[Vocalion Records|Vocalion]] record company. As with many records of this type, the [[recording artist]]s are not credited. The labels on the records mention only the song title, the style of music (e.g. [[Foxtrot (dance)|foxtrot]], [[waltz]]), and in some cases the name of the [[songwriter]] or [[composer]]. Little Marvel records were sold exclusively at UK [[Woolworths Group plc|Woolworth's]] chain stores from [[1921 in music|1921]] to [[1928 in music|1928]], at a retail price of 6d (sixpence). ==See also== * [[List of record labels]] [[Category:British record labels]] [[Category:Record labels established in 1921]] [[Category:Record labels disestablished in 1928]]
